result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis J Sparks

records.addlTxt: 1:41 PM Defendant Curtis J Sparks not in court.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Curtis J Sparks.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Bench warrant authorized on non-appearance - $200 Cash.  Court stays issuance of warrant until 4:00 PM this afternoon.

Defendant Curtis J Sparks appeared by video, Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin appeared in court for Curtis J Sparks, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jolin received complaint waives reading and enters not guilty. Court accepts waiver and enters pleas. Court sets pre trial May 17th at 1:30 pm. bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Curtis J Sparks not in court, Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin appeared in court for Curtis J Sparks, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jolin informs the court the Defendant has transferred jails and she request and adjournment. Court adjourns initial appearance to March 7th at 9:45 am. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Court sets adjourned initial appearance to February 28th at 10:30 to allow time for counsel.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court adjourns matter until February 7th at 1:00 pm to allow time for criminal complaint. bond continued.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets $1500.00 signature bond. Conditions, No contact with B.S. dob 1986. Court sets initial appearance for February 4th at 1:00 pm.
